result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Sarah A. Schofro

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Sarah A. Schofro
Current: 922 74TH ST, Kenosha, WI 53143 United States  (Effective: 10-03-2022)
Prior: 4530 40th Avenue, Kenosha, WI 53144 
Resent notification of Assignment of Judge dated 07/29/22

Defendant Sarah A. Schofro appeared with Attorney Michael A. Forella.  Defendant in custody.    Deputy District Attorney Carli McNeill appeared for the State.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  ST called witness KPD Ofc Luke Hofmann; sworn in and testified; cross-examination by Atty Forella. ST rested and moved for bind over; arguments heard. Probable cause found; bound over for trial. Information filed; reading waived. Not guilty pleas entered. Scheduling Order given to Attorney in court. DE motion to modify bond; arguments heard; Court denies motion.   Bond continued.  Judicial Pretrial - in court scheduled for October 27, 2022 at 09:30 am.
at the request of Atty Forella and no objection by DDA McNeill, STC on 08-17 is canceled and a preliminary hearing for 08-31 at 9am is scheduled.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Defendant Sarah A. Schofro in court, in custody.  Attorney Brendaliz Valdes appeared for the Prosecution.  Clerk JT  Minutes:  SPD has been unable to appoint an attorney for DE for today's hearing. Court holds colloquy with DE re: proceeding pro se or waiving time to allow SPD to appoint an attorney.  DE waives time for preliminary hearing. Court reschedules preliminary hearing to an attorney status hearing.  Bond continued.  Status conference scheduled for August 17, 2022 at 01:00 pm.
